  "article_text": [
    "a _ cancellative hoop _ is an algebra @xmath2 satisfying @xmath3 the above identities have manifold appearances , and can be seen from various points of view .",
    "first of all , they characterize the equational theory of truncated addition . indeed , the class @xmath4 of cancellative hoops coincides with the equational class generated by @xmath5 , where @xmath6 .",
    "therefore , they suffice to capture all identities valid in the positive reals . also , cancellative hoops are precisely the positive cones of lattice - ordered abelian groups ( _ @xmath7-groups _ for short ) , the latter being the abelian groups @xmath8 endowed with a lattice order @xmath9 on which the group translations act as order automorphisms .",
    "actually , more is true : the assignment @xmath10 is functorial , and provides a categorical equivalence between the class of all @xmath7-groups  ( which is generated by @xmath11 , and is equational in the language @xmath12 ) , and @xmath4  ( * ? ? ?",
    "* theorem  1.17 ) .",
    "note that the lattice operations are definable in the hoop language by @xmath13 and @xmath14 .",
    "the prototypical examples of @xmath7-groups  and hence , taking positive cones , of cancellative hoops are the sublattice - subgroups of the @xmath7-group  @xmath15 of all real - valued continuous functions on a compact hausdorff space @xmath16 , with componentwise operations .    reversing the order and",
    "changing notation provides a second point of view , of a logical nature .",
    "let @xmath17 , for some arbitrarily fixed real number @xmath18 .",
    "then @xmath19 is an order - reversing isomorphism between @xmath5 and the residuated lattice @xmath20,\\cdot,\\to,1)$ ] ; here @xmath0 $ ] is the half - open real unit interval endowed with the usual order and multiplication @xmath21 , and @xmath22 is the residuum of @xmath21 , characterized by the adjunction @xmath23 iff @xmath24 .",
    "an easy checking gives @xmath25 , and the cancellative hoop axioms translate to the familiar logical identities @xmath26 the many - valued logical system defined by the above identities has the interval @xmath0 $ ] as its set of truth - values , and is called the _ logic of cancellative hoops _",
    "@xcite , @xcite , @xcite ; it is what remains of hajek s product logic  @xcite once the falsum is removed .",
    "a third facet of the matter arises from the observation that the addition operation @xmath27 and its residuum @xmath28 capture the process of production and consumption of resources in a petri net under the firing of a transition . in the classical setting the resources at each place of a petri net",
    "are marked by an element of @xmath29 , and this setting is readily generalizable to arbitrary cancellative hoops which are called , in this setting , petri algebras .",
    "see  @xcite and references therein .",
    "an element of the cancellative hoop @xmath1 whose multiples eventually dominate any element of @xmath1 is traditionally called a strong unit or , sometimes , an order unit .",
    "since we are not dealing with the related notion of weak unit , we will simply say unit .",
    "so , explicitly , a _",
    "unit _ is an element @xmath30 such that for every @xmath31 there exists a positive integer @xmath32 with @xmath33 .",
    "an element @xmath34 of a hoop of the form @xmath35 is a unit iff @xmath36 for every @xmath37 ( remember that @xmath16 is compact hausdorff by definition ) .",
    "units arise in all contexts cited above : they are archimedean elements in the @xmath7-group  enveloping @xmath1 , gauge scales for falsity in falsum - free product logic , and universal bounds in bounded petri nets . upon defining @xmath38 , @xmath39 , @xmath40 , the interval",
    "@xmath41 is an mv - algebra , namely the equivalent algebraic semantics of ukasiewicz  infinite - valued logic . in the following we assume some familiarity with @xmath7-groups , cancellative hoops and mv - algebras , referring to  @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , @xcite for all unproved claims .",
    "let @xmath34 be a unit in the cancellative hoop @xmath1 .",

    "* theorem  2.4 ) .",
    "we are naturally interested in automorphism - invariant states , namely those states @xmath46 such that @xmath47 for every automorphism @xmath48 of @xmath1 that fixes @xmath34 .",
    "this is a quite natural requirement , since its lacking makes impossible to assign an `` average truth value '' to propositions in infinite - valued ukasiewicz  logic in a representation - independent way .",
    "the first result in this context is  ( * ? ? ?",
    "* theorem  3.4 ) , saying that integration w.r.t .",
    "the lebesgue measure is an automorphism - invariant state on the free mv - algebra over finitely many generators @xmath49 ; this has been generalized in  ( * ? ? ?",
    "* theorem  4.1 ) to all finitely presented mv - algebras . as a matter of fact , integration w.r.t .",
    "the lebesgue measure is _ the only _ ( modulo certain natural restrictions ) automorphism - invariant state on @xmath49 ; this has been proved in  @xcite using ergodic theory , and in  @xcite using algebraic means .",
    "the set @xmath50 of all states on @xmath42 is compact convex in @xmath51 ; let @xmath52 be the set of extremal states . then @xmath53 iff @xmath46 is a hoop homomorphism  ( * ? ? ?",

    "let @xmath1 be any finitely presented cancellative hoop , and let @xmath30 be any unit .",
    "our first main result , theorem  [ ref1 ] , says that for every enumeration of the discrete extremal states of @xmath42 according to nondecreasing denominators , the corresponding cesro mean converges , does not depend on the enumeration , and determines an automorphism - invariant state @xmath59 on @xmath42 .",
    "the definition of @xmath59 is thus intrinsic , because it is not based on any given representation of @xmath1 .",
    "of course _ the proof _ of the above properties is heavily based on the representation theory of @xmath7-groups  ( as well as on tools new in this circle of ideas , namely uniform distribution theory and the ehrhart theory ) .",
    "let now a representation of @xmath1 as a separating subhoop of some @xmath35 be given .",
    "contrary to standard usage , we do not assume that the elements of @xmath1 are represented by piecewise - linear functions on @xmath16 , nor that @xmath34 is represented by the constant function @xmath60 ( note however that the representing space @xmath16 is determined by  @xmath1 up to homeomorphism ; see   [ ref3 ] ) .",
    "by lemma  [ ref4](iv ) the state @xmath59 defined by theorem  [ ref1 ] corresponds to a unique borel finite measure @xmath61 on @xmath16 .",
    "let now @xmath62 be any other unit of @xmath1 , and let @xmath63 be the corresponding state and measure .",
    "in contrast with the vector lattice case  ( * ? ? ?",
    "* lemma  4.2 ) , the automorphism group of @xmath1 does not act transitively on the set of units , so @xmath34 and @xmath62 may be algebraically unrelated .",
    "nevertheless , our second main result , theorem  [ ref2 ] , says that @xmath61 and @xmath64 are absolutely continuous w.r.t .  each other , and computes explicitly the reciprocal density in terms of @xmath65 , and the dimension of @xmath16 again , a number intrinsically determined by @xmath1 .",
    "we thank the referee for his attentive reading and detailed comments on a previous version of this paper .",
    "we fix notation by recalling a few basic definitions and facts ; since the categorical equivalence between @xmath7-groups  and cancellative hoops preserves all the usual notions of homomorphism , subalgebra , dual space , @xmath66 , we shall use freely well - known facts from the theory of @xmath7-groups .",
    "the _ maximal spectrum _ of the cancellative hoop @xmath1 is the space @xmath67 whose elements are the maximal ideals of @xmath1 ( i.e. , the kernels of the hoop homomorphisms from @xmath1 to @xmath56 ) , endowed with the hull - kernel topology , namely the topology generated by all sets of the form @xmath68 , for @xmath69 varying in @xmath1 .",

    "@xmath190-dimensional rational polytopal complex _ is a finite set @xmath353 of rational polytopes in @xmath134 such that each face of each element of @xmath353 belongs to @xmath353 , every two elements intersect in a possibly empty common face , at least one element is @xmath190-dimensional and none is @xmath354-dimensional , for @xmath355 .",

    ".   the only set of dimension @xmath511 is the empty set .",
    "a space has local dimension @xmath637 at a point @xmath383 if @xmath383 has arbitrarily small neighborhoods whose boundaries have dimension @xmath638 .",
    "3 .   a space has dimension @xmath637 if it has local dimension @xmath637 at each of its points .",
    "a space has local dimension @xmath113 at @xmath383 if it has local dimension @xmath637 at @xmath383 , and does not have local dimension @xmath638 at @xmath383 .",
    "a space has dimension @xmath113 if it has dimension @xmath637 and does not have dimension @xmath638 .",
    "a space has dimension @xmath639 if it does not have dimension @xmath637 for any @xmath113 .    in the proof of theorem  [ ref15 ]",
    "we already made use of the fact that the dimension of a polytopal set coincides with its topological dimension ( note that throughout this paper the unqualified word `` dimension '' always refers to the affine dimension ) .",
    "the following lemma provides a local version of that fact .",

    "every convex combination of automorphism - invariant states is clearly an automorphism - invariant state , so it suffices to show that every @xmath694 is such a state .",
    "fix then @xmath356 such that @xmath695 , and say that @xmath132 is the underlying set of the polytopal complex @xmath353 .",
    "let @xmath696 ; then @xmath697 is an @xmath354-dimensional rational polytopal set which , by lemma  [ ref20](iii ) , depends on @xmath132 and @xmath354 only .",
    "the restriction map @xmath698 is a homomorphism from @xmath131 to @xmath699 , and the latter hoop is finitely presented because @xmath697 is rational .",
    "every element of the enumeration @xmath700 provided by the hypotheses corresponds to a point of @xmath697 , and can thus be seen as a discrete extremal state of @xmath699 , with preservation of denominators .",
    "moreover , all discrete extremal states of @xmath699 appear in the enumeration , except those corresponding to points of @xmath697 whose local dimension _ as points of @xmath132 _ is @xmath647 ( for example , for @xmath701 in the polytopal set @xmath702 of example  [ ref28 ] , we have @xmath703 , @xmath704 , and the point of intersection of @xmath274 with @xmath260 is the only such point ) .",
    "let @xmath705 , @xmath706 , and write for simplicity s sake @xmath707 .",
    "let @xmath708 be an upper bound for @xmath99 , and let @xmath709 be the functions ( in general not continuous ) which agree with @xmath99 on @xmath678 but are identically @xmath98 ( respectively , @xmath231 ) on @xmath710 .",
    "we construct a denominator - nondecreasing sequence @xmath492 of all rational points of @xmath711 , containing a subsequence @xmath712 such that @xmath713 corresponds to @xmath714 , for every @xmath235 ( this just amounts to `` reinserting '' the missing states in the given enumeration ) .",
    "it is clear that we have , for every @xmath235 , @xmath715 now , the reinserted points ( i.e. , the points in the sequence @xmath716 which do not belong to the subsequence ) are all contained in @xmath717 , which is a @xmath718-nullset . by  ( * ? ? ? * exercise  1.12 p.  179 ) and theorem  [ ref1 ] applied to @xmath719 , the two extreme terms of   converge as @xmath720 to @xmath721 .",
    "therefore the middle term converges to the same value , as was to be shown .",

    "let @xmath461 be an @xmath354-dimensional unimodular simplex contained in @xmath759 ( not necessarily belonging to @xmath528 ) , and let @xmath760 be the vertices of @xmath461",

    "therefore by lemma  [ ref25 ] @xmath763 since the unimodular simplexes generate the borel @xmath48-algebra , @xmath669 is the measure @xmath764 of  ( * ? ? ?",
    "* theorem  2.1 ) . therefore the identity  , which in our specific case reads @xmath765 agrees with the expression  ( 4 ) on  @xcite for the state  @xmath723 .",
    "if @xmath132 contains isolated points , say @xmath766 , then the situation is slightly different .",
    "indeed , the measure @xmath767 corresponding to our @xmath768 is @xmath769 while the measure @xmath770 determined by  ( 4 ) on  @xcite is @xmath771 in general @xmath767 and @xmath770 are different , but they both are automorphism - invariant , since every automorphism of @xmath772 must act on @xmath773 in a denominator - preserving way .    for example , let again @xmath774 be the polytopal set of example  [ ref28 ] , @xmath775 , @xmath776 .",
    "then @xmath777 , @xmath778 , @xmath779 ; take to be the projection on the first coordinate . then @xmath780 while @xmath781    the hidden reason for the rigidity of the invariant measure on the higher - dimensional parts of the spectrum , together with its relative flexibility on the , is subtle : the @xmath98-dimensional part is made of finitely many isolated discrete extremal states , while the higher - dimensional parts contain infinitely many discrete extremal states .",
    "now , in a finite average the input data can be rearranged arbitrarily without affecting the final result , a fact which is definitely false for infinite averages .",
    "actually , a classical result by descovich ( but dating back to von neumann for the real unit interval  ( * ? ? ?",
    "* theorems  ii.4.4 and iii.2.5 ) ) guarantees that _ every _ regular borel measure on a compact hausdorff space with no isolated points can be realized as in lemma  [ ref10](ii ) by enumerating appropriately the elements of any given countable everywhere dense subset . in our case ,",
    "the set of all discrete extremal states is such a subset , and in theorem  [ ref1 ] the key constraint on the resulting measure is the denominator - nondecreasing condition , which becomes irrelevant precisely on the @xmath98-dimensional part of the spectrum . as that condition depends crucially on the choice of a unit",
    ", it is apparent that units and measures are inextricably intertwined .",
    "g.  panti .",
    "the automorphism group of falsum - free product logic . in s.  aguzzoli et  al . , editor , _ algebraic and proof - theoretic aspects of non - classical logics _",
    ", number 4460 in lecture notes in artificial intelligence , pages 275289 .",
    "springer , 2007 ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> the half - open real unit interval @xmath0 $ ] is closed under the ordinary multiplication and its residuum . </S>",
    "<S> the corresponding infinite - valued propositional logic has as its equivalent algebraic semantics the equational class of cancellative hoops . fixing a strong unit in a cancellative hoop equivalently , in the enveloping lattice - ordered abelian group amounts to fixing a gauge scale for falsity . in this paper </S>",
    "<S> we show that any strong unit in a finitely presented cancellative hoop @xmath1 induces naturally ( i.e. , in a representation - independent way ) an automorphism - invariant positive normalized linear functional on @xmath1 . since @xmath1 is representable as a uniformly dense set of continuous functions on its maximal spectrum , such functionals in this context usually called states amount to automorphism - invariant finite borel measures on the spectrum . </S>",
    "<S> different choices for the unit may be algebraically unrelated ( e.g. , they may lie in different orbits under the automorphism group of @xmath1 ) , but our second main result shows that the corresponding measures are always absolutely continuous w.r.t .  each other , and provides an explicit expression for the reciprocal density . </S>"
  ]
}
